intro: Dasymaschalon robinsonii, commonly known as the Robinson's dasymaschalon, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide range of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
